title: The person that created Sett's E has no idea how bashing heads together works.
body:
Sett should be grabbing his left and right and bashing their heads together.

When was the last time you saw someone bashing 2 heads together grab his back and front? -.-

Did they make it so unrealistic to make the champion as easy as possible? Because making this skill grab sett's sides would actually introduce skill to the fucking champ. When you chase you would need to turn sideways to grab your target.

Right now it just feels stupid to me.

What do you people think? Have you EVER in the history of EVER, or in any fiction seen ANYONE bash 2 heads together like Sett does it?

Just wondering.

replies.body: ... Its a skillshot..... like thresh's flay.... your positioning is irrelevant, where your mouse is is relevant.

You don't remember old nida W? 
She would jump to where she was facing.

I already said it would be to make the champion more mechanically intense.
He's a 7 foot tall wolverine man. Who cares how realistic any of his moves are?

So, if senna was holding her pistol backwards you wouldn't care cause it's fiction? xD

I think the concept of bashing heads is great and should have been given in a more realistic, raw and satisfying to watch way.

Not to mention, if it was like how I said, the champion would at least be SOMEWHAT mechanically challenging.
Try it again, this time with your mouse to the side of Sett.

I mean it should be like the Old Nida cougar W in the sense that it would always grab the sides of where your champion is facing.

To at least introduce SOME mechanics to this champion.

I have to say, the first time I cast it, my aim was 90 degrees off. I expected him to reach out to the sides while facing the targeted direction. Still, it does make gameplay sense for the ability to have its effect at the targeted location (with the corresponding effect in the opposite direction).
